title: Remove global typography text-shadow for clearer readability

requirements.summary: Remove the global site-wide text-shadow applied to typography so all headings/body text render without shadows while keeping the waterfall background/overlay unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: In `frontend/src/index.css`, the global typography rule that applies `text-shadow` to elements (e.g., h1â€“h6, p, span, a, li, label, div[class*="text"]) is removed or updated so `text-shadow` is not applied.
No headings or body text on any page shows a text-shadow in the browser (verify at least Home, About, Services, Skills, Portfolio, Contact).
The waterfall background and overlay remain unchanged and continue to sit behind all page content (no interaction blocking).

Typography remains readable after shadow removal; if any text becomes hard to read, adjust only global color tokens (e.g., `--foreground`, `--muted-foreground`) rather than adding back shadows or page-specific overrides.

file_operations.description: Remove (or neutralize) the global typography selector block that applies `text-shadow` to headings and common text elements so shadows are not applied anywhere. If readability regresses after removal, adjust only global color tokens (e.g., `--foreground`, `--muted-foreground`) in the same file; do not add page-specific overrides and do not change the waterfall background/overlay styles.
